page.title: 01Mattingley Area - Landscape.
page.content: { MATTINGLEY, DIPLEY}&{HAZELEY}suggest that the area was once an extensive forest until clearings were made for these tiny villages.{Street End Copse survives as a large area of woodland to the SW of the block whilst{Hazeley {Heath}covers a large part of the NE corner of the block. The latter (reaching 88m above sea level) provides some fine views across the block. The{River Whitewater}flows from South to North through the centre of the block some 30m below Hazeley Heath. The floodplain of this stream is low- lying & provides a route for a line of electricity pylons which create their own mark on the landscape. The{River {Hart}just enters the NE corner of the block. The remainder of the block (approximately two thirds of the area) is farmed - see 'Farming'.
